content:
FILE_WRITTEN:.github/workflows/e2e_failure.yml  
DIR_STATE:[".github/workflows/e2e_failure.yml"]  

This workflow now triggers on failed `e2e` runs (or manually), reuses the standardized `.github/actions/e2e-common` setup, and delegates failure-only diagnostics and artifact bundling to `.github/actions/e2e-on-failure` with consistent inputs.

output.code:
from pathlib import Path
import json, textwrap, os, re
target_path = Path('/mnt/data').joinpath('.github/workflows/e2e_failure.yml')
target_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)

chunks = []
chunks.append(textwrap.dedent("""\
name: e2e (on failure)

on:
  workflow_run:
    workflows: ["e2e"]
    types: [completed]
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      run_id:
        description: "Optional: workflow run id to triage (defaults to current run for workflow_run events)."
        required: false
        type: string
      artifact_name:
        description: "Artifact name to download from the e2e run (if present)."
        required: false
        default: e2e-artifacts
        type: string

permissions:
  contents: read
  actions: read

concurrency:
  group: e2e-failure-${{ github.event.workflow_run.id || github.run_id }}
  cancel-in-progress: false
"""))

chunks.append(textwrap.dedent("""\
jobs:
  triage:
    name: Collect diagnostics and upload bundle
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: >-
      ${{
        github.event_name == 'workflow_dispatch' ||
        (github.event_name == 'workflow_run' && github.event.workflow_run.conclusion != 'success')
      }}
    env:
      E2E_ARTIFACTS_DIR: .e2e_failure_artifacts
      E2E_LOGS_DIR: .e2e_failure_logs
"""))

chunks.append(textwrap.dedent("""\
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Common e2e setup (python, cache, deps)
        uses: ./.github/actions/e2e-common
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
          requirements-path: docs/e2e/requirements-ci.txt
          cache-key-prefix: e2e

      - name: Resolve run id
        id: run
        shell: bash
        run: |
          set -euo pipefail
          if [[ "${{ github.event_name }}" == "workflow_dispatch" && -n "${{ inputs.run_id }}" ]]; then
            echo "id=${{ inputs.run_id }}" >> "$GITHUB_OUTPUT"
          else
            echo "id=${{ github.event.workflow_run.id || github.run_id }}" >> "$GITHUB_OUTPUT"
          fi

      - name: Prepare directories
        shell: bash
        run: |
          set -euo pipefail
          mkdir -p "${E2E_ARTIFACTS_DIR}" "${E2E_LOGS_DIR}"
"""))

chunks.append(textwrap.dedent("""\
      - name: Download artifacts from e2e run (best-effort)
        continue-on-error: true
        uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: ${{ inputs.artifact_name || 'e2e-artifacts' }}
          path: ${{ env.E2E_ARTIFACTS_DIR }}
          run-id: ${{ steps.run.outputs.id }}
          github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

      - name: Failure-only diagnostics + upload
        uses: ./.github/actions/e2e-on-failure
        with:
          artifacts-dir: ${{ env.E2E_ARTIFACTS_DIR }}
          logs-dir: ${{ env.E2E_LOGS_DIR }}
          source-run-id: ${{ steps.run.outputs.id }}
          upload-name: e2e-failure-bundle
          summary-title: "E2E failure triage"

      - name: Always show directory state (debug)
        if: always()
        shell: bash
        run: |
          set -euo pipefail
          echo "Artifacts dir:"
          ls -la "${E2E_ARTIFACTS_DIR}" || true
          echo "Logs dir:"
          ls -la "${E2E_LOGS_DIR}" || true
"""))

final_text = '\n'.join(block.strip('\n') for block in chunks).strip() + '\n'
target_path.write_text(final_text, encoding='utf-8')
print('FILE_WRITTEN:.github/workflows/e2e_failure.yml')
print('DIR_STATE:' + json.dumps(sorted(str(p.relative_to(Path("/mnt/data"))) for p in target_path.parent.glob('*') if p.is_file())))
print("LINES:", len(final_text.splitlines()))

content.text:
FILE_WRITTEN:.github/workflows/e2e_failure.yml  
DIR_STATE:[".github/workflows/e2e_failure.yml"]  

This workflow now triggers on failed `e2e` runs (or manually), reuses the standardized `.github/actions/e2e-common` setup, and delegates failure-only diagnostics and artifact bundling to `.github/actions/e2e-on-failure` with consistent inputs.
